result.execSummary:
The defendant Julio C. BAUTISTA was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Notice.
Minutes.
RE:  Possess THC - 2nd offense, on 11-01-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of felony possess THC.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 11-24-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.   Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on a probation hold.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
